meanings.definition: A person or thing that excludes or keeps out others.
meanings.sent1: The excluder at the party refused to let anyone in without an invitation.
meanings.sent2: The excluder at the gate ensured only authorized personnel could enter the premises.
meanings.sent3: The excluder at the zoo mistakenly kept out the zookeeper, causing chaos.
meanings.sent4: Her closed-off heart acted as an excluder, pushing away anyone who tried to get close.
meanings.sent5: The excluder in the form of a locked door made it clear that no one was welcome inside.

meanings.definition: A device or mechanism used to prevent something from entering or being included.
meanings.sent1: The excluder on the machine stopped any foreign objects from getting inside.
meanings.sent2: The excluder on the filter ensured only clean water passed through.
meanings.sent3: The excluder on the fridge door played a prank by keeping the snacks hidden.
meanings.sent4: The force field acted as an excluder, shielding the city from danger.
meanings.sent5: The excluder in the form of a password protected the sensitive information from unauthorized access.
